channel.title: Girlfriend
channel.description:
basically my girlfriend is going to a party this weekend (on saturday) and I need some advice on what to do. i don't mind her going to a party, it's just the fact that:
[ul][li]boys will be there[/li] [li]she's wearing like a slutty dress[/li] [li]the party is about 4 hours away, so if anything does happen I won't know about it[/li] [li]she's drinking and I know what she's like when she drinks!!! it's not good. me being the good boyfriend I am, I don't want to ruin her night by saying don't drink because I want her to enjoy herself and have a good time[/li][/ul]
further information: I do trust her, but things do happen and I really do like her. Also, I'm allowed to go but it will cost around £40 pounds for train fees, last train is at 11. this would mean that I would only spend 1 hour at the party with her, pointless.
so yeah, I was thinking of using the 'I don't give a shit' attitude, you know say 'have fun', etc etc. then on the night of the party just go out and get drunk or whatever. by not texting her, she will focus on me and what what I'm doing.
I trust her, I just don't trust the guys (even though I don't know them); but I know what every guy thinks when they see a 'fitty'.
anyway, thoughts are appreciated on this situation.

item.title: Girlfriend
item.dc:creator: @OBEYxChronik OBEYxChronik
item.description:
@OBEYxChronik wrote:

MAn I know this feeling . I would put on the same crappy attitude act haha. And whatever you do… do NOT I repeat do NOT play the what if game with yourself man. Biggest mistake you can do. Cause then you can assume something it not be true and go through all of that bull crap. And if it’s that big of an issue to you… I know how to tap cell phones althought being a snoop also comes with the possibility that you might see something that you might not want to see so id keep that in the back of your head as well.

Good luck to ya,

Read full topic

item.title: Girlfriend
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:74, topic:510310”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=628556.msg4270918#msg4270918 date=1364521244]

Simple, don’t date sluts. Girls that dress likes sluts don’t deviate much from what they wear lol. If she’s stupid enough to go to a party dressed like a slut, then people are going to treat her like one. Especially when everyone’s drinking.

Just my opinion.

Some of the coolest girls I know dress ‘slutty’. I know virgins that have dressed slutty before…
[/quote]
The chances of meeting a slutty virgin I’m going to guess are VERY low. I’m not saying they’re not cool people, that’s not for me to judge. I’m pointing out the fact that going to a party dressed slutty with the intention of drinking, surrounded by guys and not accompanied by a boyfriend just seems like a really stupid ass idea to me.[/quote]
Please stop, you seem to think things are black and white. Remember females are strange creatures.

Read full topic

It is based 100% off the girl, not the outfit, nor surroundings. (rape being the exception)

She could know her limit to alcohol. She could be smart enough not to get with another guy. You never know.
If anyone is like me, no matter how drunk, you remember the night, and don’t get a hangover (hah so lucky). I can control myself completely. I even remember everything that happen the night I got drunk enough to black out and vomit.
and define “slutty virgin” lol.

Go to the party, don’t let her know you are there, hide and if u see her starting to get in the zone then all of a sudden go out there, smack her silly then fuck another chick…

item.title: Girlfriend
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

The first mistake was posting this thread on this forum because this forum doesn’t know how to take a serious question at-hand nor is this forum a question-based for real life sort of forum.

I saw a post earlier stating to see if you two can find a “better” sort-of clothing that you BOTH agree on - I agree on that much. Though, I have different perspectives on how protective we should, and how much we shouldn’t etc., but I don’t care enough to explain so the best thing to do is trust her, hope that she doesn’t get drunk enough to do something retarded.

Plus, since you can’t trust her enough with her drunk - that should be the first sign, don’t you think?

Read full topic

item.title: Girlfriend
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Trust her. You’re her boyfriend, not her parents. You shouldn’t tell her “You can’t go”, that’s basically telling her that you don’t trust her and what she’ll do while drunk. Nor should you have the right to stop her from a party that she wants to go to, that’s up to her, not you to be honest.

If you’re really that concerned about her then just ask a friend that you trust to keep an eye on her.

Read full topic
